data.text: Want to know how the IMF is helping ensure transparent and accountable use of #COVID19 financial assistance? Click here: https://t.co/16mWMtVv69 https://t.co/oDpsiWP0JR

What are state-owned enterprises? Earlier this week the IMF’s #Mauro spoke to @hallbenjamin @FT to discuss the role these companies play in the time of #COVID19. More on our #IMFBlog https://t.co/kpKk1PbGA9 #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/WQIlSPe4Pq
The IMF is fully committed to supporting its member countries during the #COVID19 pandemic. Learn more about our work to address this global challenge: https://t.co/ahowlEjAOF https://t.co/hUeMwgGv3m

The IMF has approved $411 million in emergency assistance for #Ethiopia to help fight the coronavirus pandemic. It has also approved Ethiopia’s request for a suspension of debt service payments of about $12 million to the IMF.  https://t.co/v6u07wsxXa #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/FbuAonE58o

New IMF research shows that countries need to invest about $20 trillion over the next 20 years in #infrastructure, #climateaction & other #SDGs.
More on our #IMFblog https://t.co/iyLfkNbVfd
I#COVID19 #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/gOvfcqZWgY

Earlier this week, IMF’s #Pattillo spoke to @TIME @JustinWorland about how governments need to invest in #climateaction, #SDGs, & infrastructure in a transparent & accountable way during the #COVID19 recovery. More in the #FiscalMonitor. https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ #Greenrecovery https://t.co/7JtbeY4uOe

The IMF Executive Board today approved additional emergency funding of US$121 million to help the #KyrgyzRepublic finance #COVID19 health & economic relief. This follows an earlier approval of US$120.9 million. https://t.co/zmxwxNFM4s https://t.co/zzdo1ZKyJf

IMF‘s Zhang at #BoaoForum: Strong multilateral and regional cooperation is needed to complement national efforts. No country can succeed by itself. Read his keynote speech: https://t.co/8BbpieHBko https://t.co/Ray8MXSW1t
The IMF Executive Board today approved US$31.2 million to help #Seychelles deal with the economic impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/AdnfxdBO9Z #IMFAfrica https://t.co/ESOBkatjYi
IMF's Zhang: Asia’s economic growth will come to a standstill in 2020. Asia has not experienced zero growth in the last 60 years. https://t.co/JZ8FM4QHET #BoaoForum https://t.co/NwIkc7HPX0

IMF's Zhang: Emerging markets and developing economies face challenges including the health crisis, a severe external demand shock, a dramatic tightening in global financial conditions, and plunging commodity prices. https://t.co/NjxpSeiJmT #BoaoForum https://t.co/85S8bZlxsw

#COVID19 is threatening lives and livelihoods across sub-Saharan #Africa. This will hit growth. How hard is too soon to say, but the international community needs to do its utmost to help. https://t.co/FXzaBzZOos #IMFBlog

In an interview with #IMFCountryFocus, Fikadu Digafe Huriso, Vice Governor and Chief Economist of the National Bank of Ethiopia describes the impact of #COVID19 on his country, and the measures which #Ethiopia is taking to combat the pandemic. https://t.co/XwXTfMJsXu

.@KGeorgieva on @BloombergTV: Buckle up! We are on the road less traveled. The best we can do in a situation like this is to learn together, cooperate as much as possible, and those that are stronger do more so those that are weaker can benefit from measures taken elsewhere. https://t.co/ef5Uiv0j6L

#Nepal has become the 50th country to receive IMF emergency financial assistance. The IMF Executive Board approved yesterday US$214 million to help the country fight the social and economic impact of #COVID19.  https://t.co/Nhhd2cvbcR https://t.co/V2Bzir0KZ1

Productivity of state-owned enterprises in countries with perceived lower corruption is more than 3x higher than in countries where corruption is seen as severe. Read why governance matters in the new #IMFblog #Fiscalmonitor https://t.co/Wa6y1kWQhf https://t.co/pLQqK93qEM

State-owned enterprises are important providers of essential services like 🚰⚡️ & 🚋, and  play a crucial role in the time of #COVID19. IMF’s #Mauro talks to @FT’s @hallbenjamin about how countries can get the most out of these enterprises. #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/Wds9S66iS6
How countries can get the most out of state owned-enterprises. #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/PKlR4c64ts

Countries can improve the performance of state-owned enterprises in the time of #COVID19 if they:
1️⃣ Get incentives right
2️⃣ Asses the relevance & value of the enterprise 
3️⃣ Provide proper funding 
4️⃣ Create a fair playing field
Learn more: https://t.co/0Yl5Bmnl97 https://t.co/jwZDDM2zNi

Some state-owned enterprises are big and global. New IMF research highlights how countries can get the most out of these companies. https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ
#Fiscalmonitor https://t.co/1prwRveUK7

State-owned enterprises: At their best, they can help countries achieve economic & social goals. At their worst, they need bailouts from taxpayers & hinder economic growth. Which version you get depends on good governance & accountability. #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/r40EOVP6nW https://t.co/lYXNpD3zJs
